p: We observed stronger potential flow alterations in the Kinzig compared to the Treene catchment, probably due to different catchment characteristics. The Treene is a lowland groundwater‐dominated river with low hydrological gradients (Guse et al., 2015; Kiesel, Fohrer, Schmalz, & White, 2010; Pfannerstill, Guse, & Fohrer, 2014) which showed low ranges of flow alterations; however, the Kinzig is a precipitation‐driven lower‐mountainous river with high hydrological gradients which will be highly affected by the climate change‐induced flow alterations.
